parameters.name: varianceThreshold
parameters.description: threshold for adaptive accumulation

parameters.name: backgroundColor
parameters.description: background color and alpha (linear A/RGB/RGBA), if no map_backplate is set

objects.name: obj
objects.description: The OBJ material is the workhorse material supported by both the SciVis renderer and the path tracer (the Ambient Occlusion renderer only uses the kd and d parameter). It offers widely used common properties like diffuse and specular reflection and is based on the MTL material format of Lightwaveâ€™s OBJ scene files.

parameters.name: kd
parameters.description: diffuse color (linear RGB)

parameters.name: ks
parameters.description: specular color (linear RGB)

parameters.name: ns
parameters.description: shininess (Phong exponent), usually in [2-10^4]

parameters.name: d
parameters.description: opacity

parameters.name: tf
parameters.description: transparency filter color (linear RGB)

parameters.name: map_bump
parameters.description: normal map

objects.name: principled
objects.description: The Principled material is the most complex material offered by the path tracer, which is capable of producing a wide variety of materials (e.g., plastic, metal, wood, glass) by combining multiple different layers and lobes. It uses the GGX microfacet distribution with approximate multiple scattering for dielectrics and metals, uses the Oren-Nayar model for diffuse reflection, and is energy conserving.

parameters.name: baseColor
parameters.description: base reflectivity (diffuse and/or metallic, linear RGB)

parameters.name: edgeColor
parameters.description: edge tint (metallic only, linear RGB)

parameters.name: metallic
parameters.description: mix between dielectric (diffuse and/or specular) and metallic (specular only with complex IOR) in [0-1]

parameters.name: diffuse
parameters.description: diffuse reflection weight in [0-1]

parameters.name: specular
parameters.description: specular reflection/transmission weight in [0-1]

parameters.name: ior
parameters.description: dielectric index of refraction

parameters.name: transmission
parameters.description: specular transmission weight in [0-1]

parameters.name: transmissionColor
parameters.description: attenuated color due to transmission (Beer's law, linear RGB)

parameters.name: transmissionDepth
parameters.description: distance at which color attenuation is equal to transmissionColor

parameters.name: roughness
parameters.description: diffuse and specular roughness in [0-1], 0 is perfectly smooth

parameters.name: anisotropy
parameters.description: amount of specular anisotropy in [0-1]

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.description: rotation of the direction of anisotropy in [0-1], 1 is going full circle

parameters.name: normal
parameters.description: default normal map/scale for all layers

parameters.name: baseNormal
parameters.description: base normal map/scale (overrides default normal)

parameters.name: thin
parameters.description: flag specifying whether the material is thin or solid

parameters.name: thickness
parameters.description: thickness of the material (thin only), affects the amount of color attenuation due to specular transmission

parameters.name: backlight
parameters.description: amount of diffuse transmission (thin only) in [0-2], 1 is 50% reflection and 50% transmission, 2 is transmission only

parameters.name: coatThickness

parameters.name: coatRoughness
parameters.description: clear coat roughness in [0-1], 0 is perfectly smooth

parameters.name: coatNormal
parameters.description: clear coat normal map/scale (overrides default normal)

parameters.name: sheen
parameters.description: sheen layer weight in [0-1]

parameters.name: sheenColor

parameters.name: sheenTint

parameters.name: opacity

objects.name: metal
objects.description: The path tracer offers a physical metal, supporting changing roughness and realistic color shifts at edges.

parameters.name: ior
parameters.description: data array of spectral samples of complex refractive index, each entry in the form (wavelength, eta, k), ordered by wavelength (which is in nm)

parameters.name: eta
parameters.description: RGB complex refractive index, real part

parameters.name: k
parameters.description: RGB complex refractive index, imaginary part

parameters.name: roughness
parameters.description: roughness in [0-1], 0 is perfect mirror

objects.name: alloy
objects.description: The path tracer offers an alloy material, which behaves similar to Metal, but allows for more intuitive and flexible control of the color.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: reflectivity at normal incidence (0 degree, linear RGB)

parameters.name: edgeColor
parameters.description: reflectivity at grazing angle (90 degree, linear RGB)

parameters.name: roughness
parameters.description: roughness, in [0-1], 0 is perfect mirror

objects.name: glass
objects.description: The path tracer offers a realistic a glass material, supporting refraction and volumetric attenuation (i.e., the transparency color varies with the geometric thickness).

parameters.name: eta
parameters.description: index of refraction

parameters.name: attenuationColor
parameters.description: resulting color due to attenuation (linear RGB)

parameters.name: attenuationDistance
parameters.description: distance affecting attenuation

objects.name: thinGlass
objects.description: The path tracer offers a thin glass material useful for objects with just a single surface, most prominently windows. It models a thin, transparent slab, i.e., it behaves as if a second, virtual surface is parallel to the real geometric surface. The implementation accounts for multiple internal reflections between the interfaces (including attenuation), but neglects parallax effects due to its (virtual) thickness.

parameters.name: eta
parameters.description: index of refraction

parameters.name: attenuationColor
parameters.description: resulting color due to attenuation (linear RGB)

parameters.name: attenuationDistance
parameters.description: distance affecting attenuation

parameters.name: thickness
parameters.description: virtual thickness
